another show of hands: for an Android library  that does a task (SQL, network, 3D...) what would you rather have for logging
an internal abstract class you have to implement with your favourite logger (Like the latest OkHttp) +2 votes already
slf4j-api to be implemented by you...or default to nop (Your Java SE wisdom) +1 vote
roll the Android logger at the libraries' discretion with enables, disables, log levels, etc (Literally every Android library)

text: yes we all absolutely love any tool/library that comes from facebook
switches off sarcasm
I played around with it for a while but can’t see much improvement over gradle
that said, our app doesn’t have 35 million classes yet
I’d rather try bazel than buck
<@U053PPGDC>: was it rather easy to convert your app to the 'format' required by buck?
didn’t try that
tried building one from scratch
ah okay
if I recall you need to manually copy any libs you use
and we use a lot :simple_smile:
yeah already saw that, keep a copy of every dependency
i think my 'spike' on buck is going to be rather short :wink:
haha smart.
basically every facebook lib or tool I’ve tried and raved about for a while we ended up replacing with something else.
Bazel is Buck 2.0 apparently. The guy left Facebook for Google and rebuilt it from them. Any improvements to Buck that happened after he left were merged into Bazel afterwards, so it’s the top branch
sounds good, I'll have a look! thx

:smile:

Totally custom view: todo or not todo?
depends on your needs
universal answer I guess :smile:
you know the iOS photo’s app?
it has some kind of zoom-in animation
I have a client that wants it on Android
Current zoom using RecyclerView sucks
(resize span, requestLayout, items jump to new size and then animate to new place)
Alternative is animating remove, then resize, then animate items in again. But he doesn’t really like that. (but we think it works sooo well..)
It’s the <http://clientsfromhell.net|clientsfromhell.net> type client.
So maybe a custom view would make the animation better possible.
I’d rather convince him to go for the alternative.
<https://androidchat.slack.com/archives/development/p1449068214001842> no

attachments.title: Android Development Culture. The Document. #qualitymatters
attachments.text: Hello, dear reader, hope you are Android Developer, or you're going to be one. Android Development is in trouble (for about 7 years). Most of the projects does not have tests (unit, integration, functional); compilation and lint warnings ignored; code...
